Specific Open Access regulations in alliance and national licences are crucial in ensuring that research results can be freely published in parallel with the publications of publishers. The secondary publication rights (OA rights) negotiated in these licenses are almost never applied by researchers. This is a decisive reason for the low use of the "green path" of Open Access.
Against this background, the DFG is funding the project "OA-EZB: Open Access Services of the Electronic Journals Library (EZB)". One aim of the project is to provide information on exploitation rights applicable to the secondary publication of journal articles for facilitated and broad-based re-use in order to support authors in making their research results freely available.

Information about the journal with the ISSN:

SHERPA RoMEO is an online resource that aggregates and analyses publisher open access policies from around the world and provides summaries of self-archiving permissions and conditions of rights given to authors on a journal-by-journal basis. RoMEO is a Jisc service and has collaborative relationships with many international partners, who contribute time and effort to developing and maintaining the service.
